Catalog_Raisonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 578
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
medium: Sue ware, stoneware with natural ash glaze
text: This type of vessel is known as a “recumbent vessel, ” or yokobe. Its asymmetrical body indicates it was meant to be placed on its side—it was probably intended for storing sake (rice wine). Natural ash glaze, pooled on its surface, creates a pleasing mottled effect on its shoulders and a pattern of drips along a portion of the jar’s irregular, bulging body.
title: Recumbent bottle with long neck
